闉字的基本解释

闉
yīn
古指瓮城的门：“城闉不禁。”
城：“巧技出吴闉。”
古通“堙”：“救闉池者，以火与争鼓橐。”
姓。

闉字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yīn］
［《廣韻》於真切，平真，影。］
(1)古代城门外的瓮城。
(2)指瓮城的城门。
(3)城曲，城隅。
(4)塞，垫。
(5)屈曲。参见“闉扼”、“闉跂”。
(6)通“堙”。土山，用于攻守或瞭望。
(7)见“闉支”。

闉字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【門字部】　闉； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页1338第29
【廣韻】於眞切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】伊眞切，?音因。【說文】城內重門也。【正韻】城內曲重門也。【詩·鄭風】出其闉闍。【傳】闉，曲城也。【前漢·揚雄傳】欃槍爲闉。【註】障蔽如城門外女垣也。　又塞也。【周禮·地官】掌蜃掌斂互物蜃物，以共闉壙之蜃。【註】闉，猶塞也。【淮南子·兵略訓】獵者逐禽，車馳人趨，各盡其力，無?罰之威，而相爲斥闉要遮者，同所利也。【註】塞也。　又【易·屯卦註】窮困闉厄。　又姓。【左傳·定五年】吳子乃歸，囚闉與罷。【莊子·德充符】闉跂支離無脤。【註】闉跂支離，言脚常曲，行體不正卷縮也。無脤，名也。　又【集韻】因蓮切，音煙。曲也。【莊子·德充符】闉跂，司馬彪讀。

暂无。

inner gates
Basic explanation of words
inner gates
yīn
Ancient refers to the gate of Wengcheng: "The city can't help but."
Cheng: "Wu Xie is a clever skill."
Gu Tong "堙": "The one who saves the pond, fights with fire and fights for drums."
name.
inner gates
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yīn］
["Guangyun" is true, plain, and shadowy. ]
(1) Wengcheng outside the ancient city gate.
(2) Refers to the gate of Wengcheng.
(3) Chengqu, Chengyu.
(4) Plug, pad.
(5) Buckling. See "闉闉", "闉跂".
(6) Through "堙". Tushan, used for offense and defense or lookout.
(7) See "闉zhi".
inner gates
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Xu Ji 1] [Men Zi Department] 　闉; Kangxi strokes: 17; Page number: page 1338 29
[Guang Yun] Yu Yuqie【Jiyun】【Yunhui】【Zhengyun】Yinqie,? Yinyin. [Said the text] There are also heavy gates in the city. [Positive rhyme] There are also heavy doors in the city. 【Poetry·Zheng Feng】Experienced the escort. [Biography] Xun, Qucheng also. [Previous Han·Yang Xiong Biography] The spear is a dragon. [Note] The barriers are like Nvyuan outside the city gate.　Still again. 【Zhou Li·Guanguan】The palms of the mirages converge on each other's mirages, so as to share the mirages. [Note] Xun, Yu Sai Ye. 【Huainanzi·Strategic Training】The hunters chase the birds, the chariots rush and the people, each do their best, without the prestige of punishment. 【Note】Say also.　[Yi·Tun Gua Note] Poor and poor.　Another last name. [Zuo Zhuan·Ding Five Years] Wu Zi Naigui, the prisoner will leave. [Zhuangzi·De Chong Fu] The elbows are separated from each other. [Note] The elbows are separated, the feet are often squiggly, and the body is not curled up properly. No name, no name.　[Jiyun] Because of lotus cutting, sound and smoke. Song also. [Zhuangzi·De Chongfu] 闉跂, read by Sima Biao.

yīn
I сущ.
вторые (внешние) ворота (в полукруглой предвратной стене города)
登闉四望 подняться на внешние ворота и осмотреться вокруг
